headline: Classic Pub Style Nachos
description: Nachos baked with bubbling Cheddar cheese and fresh tomato salsa make a bright and colorful snack for a party or watching the game.
name: Classic Pub Style Nachos

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix together the onion, tomatoes, parsley, olive oil, lime juice, salt and pepper in a bowl.

Spread tortilla chips in a single layer onto a baking sheet, and spoon about 1 teaspoon of the tomato salsa onto each chip. Spread 1 cup of Cheddar cheese over the nachos, top the chips with another teaspoon or so of salsa, and top with the remaining 1 cup of cheese.
Bake the nachos in the preheated oven until the cheese is bubbling, about 5 minutes. Serve hot with sour cream, guacamole, and any remaining salsa on the side for dipping the chips.

review.reviewBody: Add some ground turkey with taco seasoning and your totally in business. This is my go to... So delicious. I use cilantro instead of parsley. So good!
Love this dish. I add cilantro and green onions to it.
Delicious nachos . Served this to my golf girls and we devoured them . Will be our go to recipe from now on
Easy and delicious, crunchy, cheesy, and you can add anything, jalapeno, cilantro, green pepper. Or follow the original recipe. Five stars! Yum yum!
Fun meal! Very great Nachos for people that do not like spicy food (My Wife). I swapped out the red onion for green. Really cheap and easy to make.
Simple and tasty. I didn't do the teaspoonfuls of salsa thingy... Just sort of layered the ingredients. Meant to add green onions but forgot. Think that will be a good addition.

I have tried this twice now, and both times the chips came out of over SOGGY. They don't stay crisp with the topping on. I will go back to just baking with cheese on top, and adding topping later like I used to do.
I made this on the camp stove, and barely followed the directions. It stilled turned out great.
Had these tonight with chicken wings. FABULOUS! Didn't change a thing. Thanks for posting this easy and tasty recipe.

Excellent! The lime juice makes the difference! Because of the use of lime, I substituted Cilantro for Parsley and Canola oil for Olive oil (too heavy). I also added sliced olives. Tested this at dinner party last night - it was a big hit with diners!
I love this, also added some chopped up jalaneo peppers. Will make this again no doubt!

I left out the olive oil since I used prepared salsa, which made chips soggy so I will only be using salsa for dipping or topping after baking chips! I modified this by adding orange bell pepper and using a shredded mexican cheese blend, green onions and only a few tablespoons of parsley. Thanks for a simple yet great tasting meatless nacho recipe!
Delicious and easy to make.Easy and fast to make and faster to go into peoples stomach. Will definitely make this again, this time I'll use the sour cream and guacamole.

These were really good. However, I found the suggestion of the one reviewer to add green onions, on top after they were done, to be needed. I used baked tortilla chips and reduced fat cheese and it worked fine. I had all of the ingredients for the pico de gallo except lime, but subbed lemon juice. To save time, I just followed the layering technique and microwaved them for 2 minutes. 1/2 recipe fit on a large dinner plate and served 2 well. TY
Yummy and simple! I topped the nachos with some chopped green onion and fresh cilantro. Thanks!
Simple and fun to make. We added some chopped up green peppers and omitted the extra guacomole and sour cream. I made this with a group of kids and they ate it all up!
